headline: 75 Years After the Liberation of Auschwitz, A Fear That ‘Never Again’ Is Not Assured
abstract: Amid a surge of anti-Semitism and a rise in dehumanizing political rhetoric, there is fear that the horrific lessons of the death camp are being lost.
lead_paragraph: AUSCHWITZ-BIRKENAU, Poland — Even before the gas chambers were destroyed and the savage toll of years of industrialized mass murder revealed to the world, prisoners at the largest Nazi concentration camp were already repeating two words: Never again.
keywords: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
